Description: Terracotta portrait of a young man with a thin beard wearing a wreath. Fragment of head only, back is broken and lost. Overfired red-brown marl fabric with grey-black core and pale yellow surface or slip. Abundant black glass and grey (volcanic), red (iron rich) and opaic quartz inclusions. Pencil marking on back
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ8
Curator's comments: Parallel from Site A, Tomb 9 at Polis-tis-Chrysokhou (British Museum GR1890,0731.53). This figurine is labelled in pencil TAΦ8 (however the first two characters are obscured and unclear), designating this as coming from a context excavated by Petrie within the sanctuary of Aphrodite, during Gardner’s excavations at Naukratis in 1885-1886. A second pencil marking reads K63, appears to relate to the Kyoto distribution.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DA.116) (Phase 3)
